intro: Hieracium transiens subsp. xanthodermum, commonly known as the yellow-centred hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early autumn, and it is characterized by its distinctive yellow central disc surrounded by yellow to orange petals. The species is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in various environments.
